com.samsung.android.sdk.accessory

Class SAAgent

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.content.Context
      • android.content.ContextWrapper
        • android.app.Service
          • com.samsung.android.sdk.accessory.SAAgent
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ComponentCallbacks, ComponentCallbacks2

    public abstract class SAAgent
extends Service
    This class provides the main interface between Service Provider/Service Consumer applications and Samsung Accessory Service Framework. Both Service Provider and Service Consumer applications must derive from this class.

    This class provides the main interface for your application (acting as a Service Provider or Service Consumer), to interact with Samsung Accessory Service Framework. Both Service Provider and Service Consumer applications must declare a subclass of this class and implement the actions of an Accessory Peer Agent (Service Provider or Service Consumer).

    Developer Guides

    When you build your application in release mode, you must add -keep lines in the proguard.cfg file of your application, to prevent ProGuard renaming your subclasses of SAAgent and SASocket. (ProGuard is a tool integrated into the Android build system that obfuscates the code by renaming classes and methods.)

    For more information about How to configure ProGuard, please visit the ProGuard page of Android Development Site. For more information about using Accessory, read the Accessory programming guide.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SAAgent

        protected SAAgent(String name,
       Class<? extends SASocket> socketClass)
        Creates a SAAgent instance with the specified name and the derived subclass of SASocket. All Service Provider and Service Consumer applications must implement the public default constructor and never call it. The constructor is dynamically referenced by Samsung Accessory SDK.
        Parameters:
        name - The name for the derived subclass that extends SAAgent base class.
        socketClass - The subclass that extends SASocket base class, which represents a Service Connection between a Service Provider and a Service Consumer.
        Since:
        2.0.19

    • Method Detail

      • onFindPeerAgentResponse

        protected abstract void onFindPeerAgentResponse(SAPeerAgent peerAgent,
                           int result)
        Called when the search for matching Accessory Peer Agents is completed. This callback serves as the response to findPeerAgents().If matching Accessory Peer Agents are found (on the same or multiple remote Accessory Devices), this callback occurs separately for each Peer Agent.

        Your service implementation must handle this callback properly. Use the result code parameter that notifies the result of the Accessory Peer Agent discovery request.If the request finds matching Peer Agents, the result code is PEER_AGENT_FOUND. In this case, you can request a Service Connection with the Peer Agent by calling requestServiceConnection(SAPeerAgent).

        If no matching Accessory Peer Agents are found, the result code is FINDPEER_SERVICE_NOT_FOUND. If no reachable Accessory Devices are found, the result code is FINDPEER_DEVICE_NOT_CONNECTED.

        Note: This method is called from the worker thread. Spawn a separate thread if you need to do any heavy lifting in this callback.

        Parameters:
        peerAgent - The SAPeerAgent instance representing the found remote Accessory Peer Agent, if the result code is PEER_AGENT_FOUND . Otherwise, null.
        result - The result code.
        Since:
        2.0.19
        See Also:
        PEER_AGENT_FOUND, FINDPEER_DEVICE_NOT_CONNECTED, FINDPEER_SERVICE_NOT_FOUND, FINDPEER_DUPLICATE_REQUEST

      • onServiceConnectionRequested

        protected void onServiceConnectionRequested(SAPeerAgent peerAgent)
        Called when a remote Accessory Peer Agent requests a Service Connection.

        If your application is not running, Samsung Accessory Service Framework invokes your application when a Service Connection request arrives from an Accessory Peer Agents.

        Your Service Provider or Service Consumer application can handle the Service Connection request from the remote Accessory Peer Agent. The default implementation is to always accept any incoming Service Connection requests from any remote Accessory Peer Agent.

        If you want to decide whether to accept or reject a Service Connection request(for example, based on the identity of requesting Accessory Peer Agent or some environment conditions, such as battery or memory levels), your application can override this method, and call acceptServiceConnectionRequest(SAPeerAgent) to accept the Service Connection request, or call rejectServiceConnectionRequest(SAPeerAgent) to reject it.

        Parameters:
        peerAgent - The remote Accessory Peer Agent that request a Service Connection.
        Since:
        2.0.19

      • onServiceConnectionResponse

        @Deprecated
protected void onServiceConnectionResponse(SASocket socket,
                                          int result)
        Deprecated. 
        Called after a Service Connection request to notify the application on whether the connection is established with a remote Accessory Peer Agent. This callback follows the call of requestServiceConnection(SAPeerAgent).

        If a Service Connection is established successfully, the SASocket object is passed. It allows the Service Provider or Service Consumer application to send and receive data from a connected Accessory Peer Agent, as well as receive Service Connection related events.

        Note: This method is been deprecated . Use onServiceConnectionResponse(SAPeerAgent, SASocket, int). Don't Call super.onServiceConnectionResponse(SASocket, int)

        Parameters:
        socket - The SASocket object representing the Service Connection, if the Service Connection is successfully established (result code is CONNECTION_SUCCESS ). Otherwise, null.
        result - The result code. CONNECTION_SUCCESS indicates a successful Service Connection, while other values indicate a failure.
        Since:
        2.0.19
        See Also:
        CONNECTION_SUCCESS, CONNECTION_ALREADY_EXIST, CONNECTION_FAILURE_NETWORK, CONNECTION_FAILURE_DEVICE_UNREACHABLE, CONNECTION_FAILURE_INVALID_PEERAGENT, CONNECTION_FAILURE_PEERAGENT_NO_RESPONSE, CONNECTION_FAILURE_PEERAGENT_REJECTED, CONNECTION_DUPLICATE_REQUEST

      • onServiceConnectionResponse

        protected void onServiceConnectionResponse(SAPeerAgent peerAgent,
                               SASocket socket,
                               int result)
        Called after a Service Connection request to notify the application on whether the connection is established with a remote Accessory Peer Agent. This callback follows the call of requestServiceConnection(SAPeerAgent).

        If a Service Connection is established successfully, the SASocket object is passed. It allows the Service Provider or Service Consumer application to send and receive data from a connected Accessory Peer Agent, as well as receive Service Connection related events.

        Note: This method is called from worker thread. Spawn a separate thread if you need to do any heavy lifting in this callback. Dont Call super.onServiceConnectionResponse(SAPeerAgent, SASocket, int)

        Parameters:
        peerAgent - The SAPeerAgent instance representing the remote Accessory Peer Agent for which Service Connection was requested.
        socket - The SASocket object representing the Service Connection, if the Service Connection is successfully established (result code is CONNECTION_SUCCESS ). Otherwise, null.
        result - The result code. CONNECTION_SUCCESS indicates a successful Service Connection, while other values indicate a failure.
        Since:
        2.1.8
        See Also:
        CONNECTION_SUCCESS, CONNECTION_ALREADY_EXIST, CONNECTION_FAILURE_NETWORK, CONNECTION_FAILURE_DEVICE_UNREACHABLE, CONNECTION_FAILURE_INVALID_PEERAGENT, CONNECTION_FAILURE_PEERAGENT_NO_RESPONSE, CONNECTION_FAILURE_PEERAGENT_REJECTED, CONNECTION_DUPLICATE_REQUEST

      • onPeerAgentUpdated

        protected void onPeerAgentUpdated(SAPeerAgent peerAgent,
                      int result)
        Called when the Peer Agent status on a connected remote Accessory Devices changes. This callback is invoked only if you have previously initiated a service discovery request by findPeerAgents().

        If more than one Peer Agents have updated status (on one or more connected Accessory Devices), this callback is invoked once for each peer service agent.

        Note: Your application can cache the Peer Agents that are notified in the callback with the result code PEER_AGENT_AVAILABLE. However, in that case, your application must handle the PEER_AGENT_UNAVAILABLE result code correctly. By caching the result of a peer discovery request, you can skip subsequent Peer Agents discovery requests until this callback shows with the result code PEER_AGENT_UNAVAILABLE.

        Note: This method is called from worker thread. Spawn a separate thread if you need to do any heavy lifting in this callback.

        Parameters:
        peerAgent - The SAPeerAgent instance representing the remote Accessory Peer Agent.
        result - The changed status of the Peer Agent.
        Since:
        2.0.19
        See Also:
        PEER_AGENT_AVAILABLE, PEER_AGENT_UNAVAILABLE

      • onError

        @Deprecated
protected void onError(String errorMessage,
                      int errorCode)
        Deprecated. 
        Called when an SAAgent error occurs in Samsung Accessory Service Framework. Implement error handling by overriding this method.
        Parameters:
        errorMessage - The error message
        errorCode - The error code
        Since:
        2.0.19
        See Also:
        ERROR_CONNECTION_INVALID_PARAM, ERROR_FATAL, ERROR_SDK_NOT_INITIALIZED, ERROR_PERMISSION_DENIED, ERROR_PERMISSION_FAILED

      • onError

        protected void onError(SAPeerAgent peerAgent,
           String errorMessage,
           int errorCode)
        Called when an SAAgent error occurs in Samsung Accessory Service Framework. Implement error handling by overriding this method.
        Parameters:
        peerAgent - The SAPeerAgent instance representing the remote Accessory Peer Agent.
        errorMessage - The error message
        errorCode - The error code
        Since:
        2.1.8
        See Also:
        ERROR_CONNECTION_INVALID_PARAM, ERROR_FATAL, ERROR_SDK_NOT_INITIALIZED, ERROR_PERMISSION_DENIED, ERROR_PERMISSION_FAILED

      • onAuthenticationResponse

        protected void onAuthenticationResponse(SAPeerAgent peerAgent,
                            SAAuthenticationToken authToken,
                            int code)
        Called when the Accessory Peer Agent authentication is completed. Callback of authenticatePeerAgent(SAPeerAgent).

        Note: This API may not be working properly depending on the firmware version of accessory device. Recommend to upgrade accessory device firmware if possible.

        Parameters:
        peerAgent - The authenticated Accessory Peer Agent
        authToken - The SAAuthenticationToken of the Accessory Peer Agent, encapsulating its authentication information.
        code - The result code.
        Since:
        2.0.19
        See Also:
        AUTHENTICATION_FAILURE_PEER_AGENT_NOT_SUPPORTED, AUTHENTICATION_FAILURE_TOKEN_NOT_GENERATED, AUTHENTICATION_SUCCESS

      • findPeerAgents

        protected final void findPeerAgents()
        Find matching Accessory Peer Agents. If a matching Accessory Peer Agent is found, your application is notified by the onFindPeerAgentResponse(SAPeerAgent, int) callback. If multiple matching Accessory Peer Agents are found, the onFindPeerAgentResponse(SAPeerAgent, int) callback occurs multiple times, one for each.
        Since:
        2.0.19

      • requestServiceConnection

        protected final void requestServiceConnection(SAPeerAgent peerAgent)
        Request a Service Connection with a remote Accessory Peer Agent. Your application will be notified the request result by the onServiceConnectionResponse(SAPeerAgent, SASocket, int) callback. Ensure the availability of the Accessory Peer Agent before calling this method. This method is typically called in the onFindPeerAgentResponse(SAPeerAgent, int) callback. You should NOT use previously cached SAPeerAgent instance, as it may be no longer available for making Service Connection with.
        Parameters:
        peerAgent - The Accessory Peer Agent with which you request Service Connection.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if peerAgent argument passed is null or invalid.
        Since:
        2.0.19

      • acceptServiceConnectionRequest

        protected void acceptServiceConnectionRequest(SAPeerAgent peerAgent)
        Accept a Service Connection request. This method can be called in the onAuthenticationResponse(SAPeerAgent, SAAuthenticationToken, int) or onServiceConnectionRequested(SAPeerAgent) callback.
        Parameters:
        peerAgent - The Peer Agent whose incoming Service Connection request to accept.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if the peerAgent argument passed is null or invalid.
        Since:
        2.0.19

      • rejectServiceConnectionRequest

        protected void rejectServiceConnectionRequest(SAPeerAgent peerAgent)
        Reject a connection request. This method can be called in the implementation of the onAuthenticationResponse(SAPeerAgent, SAAuthenticationToken, int) or onServiceConnectionRequested(SAPeerAgent) callback.
        Parameters:
        peerAgent - The Peer Agent whose incoming Service Connection request to reject.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if the peerAgent argument is null or invalid.
        Since:
        2.0.19

      • authenticatePeerAgent

        protected void authenticatePeerAgent(SAPeerAgent peerAgent)
        Authenticate an Accessory Peer Agent. The onAuthenticationResponse(SAPeerAgent, SAAuthenticationToken, int) callback occurs as a response.

        Note: This API may not be working properly depending on the firmware version of accessory device. Recommend to upgrade accessory device firmware if possible.

        Parameters:
        peerAgent - The Peer Agent to be authenticated.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if the peerAgent argument passed is null or invalid.
        Since:
        2.0.19
